RT @andreaprejean: Standards by themselves cannot raise achievement @salberti #CCSS
RT @andreaprejean: "Standards meet their potential when teachers make it their work"@salberti #CCSS
RT @rmittelstedt: @salberti :  Unless teachers are the owners these new standards will fail like all the others. #CCSS
RT @JennieBeltro: Standards don't stay after school making sure every student learns - it's teachers who do that. @salberti #ccss #coreadvo…
Another great @salberti -ism: Teachers need to be enrolled in the work, not told the work #CCSS @achievethecore
The degree to which we have not engaged educators in this work is a real problem.  We need the teacher voice says @salberti #CCSS
RT @alderson_dan: @salberti No matter how good the upcoming tests are going to be, they will never be as good as teachers who spend everyda…
We have to understand what the work is before we implement--educators need to REALLY, REALLY know it says @salberti #CCSS @achievethecore
RT @alderson_dan: @salberti Creating the CCSS was never about making education easier; it was always about making it better. #CCSS
RT @rmittelstedt: @salberti  We need schools to be learning organizations for teachers. Not just about time. Learning is not same as traini…
Says @salberti: PLCs are not a structure--they're a culture!  Educators need the opportunity to learn, that's how we @achievethecore #CCSS
Standards do NOT equal standardization.  In fact, when we do this right, we get the opposite result: innovation. @salberti @achievethecore
Teaching has always been difficult. We shouldn't simplify #CCSS. Teachers don't need sympathy to do this work, we need support. @salberti
We may update and evaluate #CCSS, but we're not going to "unlearn" the great things we've learned says @salberti http://t.co/MQUUbFMASC
It's been 4.5 years since #CCSS.  @Salberti reminds us to remember why we're doing this in the first place.  It's for the students.
Looking forward to hearing about the "state of the standards" from @salberti #CCSS
7 final exams for kgarten? Even the guy who WROTE that bill says it's crazy. Kids are on the frontline of this war says @MEall4Schools

The standards are good practice, the testing is a different entity entirely. says teacher from @COeducation. We need to find balance.

Followers need #hope.  Your own #hope as an educator helps increase your students' #hope says @hopemonger
Strategy to increase #hope: ask students to write letters to their future selves, spend time with mentors (aka the future 'you')
Where there's a will there's a way--but when a child struggles with the way, regardless of their level of will, there is low #hope.
Know the difference between goal chasing and goal setting.  Students have to be excited about the goal to chase it. This builds #hope.
How do you make #hope happen in the classroom? Listen in now with @hopemonger Dr Shane Lopez: http://t.co/ftRmhxOAYh
Students are 8X more likely to do homework if they link education to their future to a better life, then if they don't make that link. #hope
BUT, seems high #hope can serve as a "Teflon suit" for students living in poverty says @hopemonger. Join convo now: http://t.co/ftRmhxOAYh
High #hope is not correlated necessarily by ethnicity/race, but some studies suggest correlation between #hope and poverty. More data needed
@TTATweet Here's the webinar link: http://t.co/ftRmhxOAYh Will tweet link to @Gallup poll at the end of the webinar.
High #hope students are more excited about the future, more likely to go to school, more engaged. Join the convo: http://t.co/ftRmhxOAYh
Are you promoting #hope in the classroom?  #Hope is significant predictor of success-@hopemonger studies show 12% bump in school outcomes
More #hope = higher productivity and performance says @hopemonger. What do you think?
When students do more of what they do best, they have more #hope. Join the convo with @hopemonger now: http://t.co/ftRmhxOAYh
According to @hopemonger, 50% of students feel hopeful (the future will be better than the past and they have power to make it better) #hope
